 031:     # Compute X^T X and X^T y
 032:     # Note: the auto-generated C++ file from Cython, when put under common compilers,
 033:     # is not able to perform all the obvious loop optimizations as the manual C++ code
 034:     # in the PyBind11 code. It needs to manually assign temporary pointers for each
 035:     # row being reused, while similar code written in C/C++ directly would generate
 036:     # something that compilers are better able to optimize.
+037:     for i in range(n):
  __pyx_t_1 = __pyx_v_n;
  __pyx_t_2 = __pyx_t_1;
  for (__pyx_t_3 = 0; __pyx_t_3 < __pyx_t_2; __pyx_t_3+=1) {
    __pyx_v_i = __pyx_t_3;

+038:         X_row_i = X + i * p
    __pyx_v_X_row_i = (__pyx_v_X + (__pyx_v_i * __pyx_v_p));

+039:         for j in range(p):
    __pyx_t_4 = __pyx_v_p;
    __pyx_t_5 = __pyx_t_4;
    for (__pyx_t_6 = 0; __pyx_t_6 < __pyx_t_5; __pyx_t_6+=1) {
      __pyx_v_j = __pyx_t_6;

+040:             b[j] += X_row_i[j] * y[i]
      __pyx_t_7 = __pyx_v_j;
      (__pyx_v_b[__pyx_t_7]) = ((__pyx_v_b[__pyx_t_7]) + ((__pyx_v_X_row_i[__pyx_v_j]) * (__pyx_v_y[__pyx_v_i])));

+041:             x_ij = X_row_i[j]
      __pyx_v_x_ij = (__pyx_v_X_row_i[__pyx_v_j]);

+042:             A_row_j = A + j * p
      __pyx_v_A_row_j = (__pyx_v_A + (__pyx_v_j * __pyx_v_p));

+043:             for k in range(p):
      __pyx_t_7 = __pyx_v_p;
      __pyx_t_8 = __pyx_t_7;
      for (__pyx_t_9 = 0; __pyx_t_9 < __pyx_t_8; __pyx_t_9+=1) {
        __pyx_v_k = __pyx_t_9;

+044:                 A_row_j[k] += x_ij * X_row_i[k]
